H0.text: Classification is what eventually happens to a species when the environment changes and the organisms do not adapt.

H1.text: Development is what eventually happens to a species when the environment changes and the organisms do not adapt.

H2.text: Extinction eventually happens to a species when the environment changes and the organisms do not adapt.

H3.text: Regulation is what eventually happens to a species when the environment changes and the organisms do not adapt.

A4.text: Extinction may occur a long time after the events that set it in motion, a phenomenon known as extinction debt.

A5.text: Habitat degradation is currently the main anthropogenic cause of species extinctions.
